definitions: to the disadvantage of someone or something

examples.text: the plan unfavorably impacted on sales
her mother's actions always reflected unfavorably upon her
the new figures compare unfavorably with other parts of the world facing similar issues

shortDefinitions: to disadvantage of someone or something

definitions: with a lack of approval or support

examples.text: his books were viewed unfavorably and fell out of print

shortDefinitions: with lack of approval or support
